intro: Mairella yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan mairella, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features glossy, elliptical leaves and produces small, fragrant white flowers. It is often found in mountainous regions with moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
